result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney M Devalk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 4-8-18 or, if not paid, serve 10 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.

Court will consider motion for expungement after 3 years if defendant pays the costs  and has no further violations of the law including shoplifting tickets.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. No Huber. Court objects to ES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney M Devalk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Courtney M Devalk in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Courtney M Devalk in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 5 months  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.   No Huber privileges . Court objects to ES. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and surcharges by 4-8-18 or, if not paid, serve
10  days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.

Court will consider motion for expungement after 3 years if defendant pays the costs  and has no further violations of the law including shoplifting tickets.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. lr

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Courtney M Devalk not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Kmart in Milwaukee County or Nathan F

Defendant Courtney M Devalk in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Courtney M Devalk in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
